post.summary: Extract data from a single webpage (Proxy to Scraper API)
post.description: Instantly extracts data from a webpage using either a schema for structured data or markdown/html for unstructured content. This endpoint proxies requests to the scraper API.

parameters.name: schemaId
parameters.description:
Either a custom schema ID or one of the following special values:
* `html` - Returns raw HTML of the page
* `body` - Returns cleaned HTML body content
* `markdown` - Returns content converted to markdown format

link.description: The URL link to be scraped

type.description: The type of location, either auto or manual

isoCode.description: The ISO code of the location, only required if type is manual. Available locations can be found on the locations api.

location.description: The location object for the proxy

200.description: Response object containing scraping data and request metadata

status.description: Status of the response (SUCCESS, NO_DATA, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, ERROR)

location.description: The location object used for the proxy

data.description: Validated data after scraping and processing (null for NO_DATA, TIMEOUT, etc.)

requestTimeMs.description: The time taken to process the request in milliseconds

message.description: Human-readable message explaining the result (present for error/timeout scenarios)

400.description: Bad Request, either due to missing 'link' or 'schemaId'

500.description: Internal server error (rare - most failures return 200 with appropriate status)

link.description: The URL that was being scraped

location.description: The location object used for the proxy

requestTimeMs.description: The time taken to process the request in milliseconds

parameters.name: workflowIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of workflow IDs. If not provided, returns changes for all ACTIVE workflows

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date to filter changes (ISO format)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date to filter changes (ISO format)

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records to return for pagination

workflowId.description: ID of the workflow this change belongs to

data.description: Current state of the data after the change

differences.description: Structured representation of changes with object-based diffing

type.description: Type of change (added, removed, or changed)

previousValue.description: Previous field value (only present for changed type)

url.description: URL where the change was detected

screenshotUrl.description: URL of the screenshot taken when the change was detected

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the change was created

400.description: Bad request (invalid date range or workflow IDs)

401.description: Unauthorized (invalid or missing API key or Bearer token)

parameters.name: changeId
parameters.description: ID of the workflow change to retrieve

workflowId.description: ID of the workflow this change belongs to

data.description: Current state of the data after the change

differences.description: Structured representation of changes with object-based diffing

type.description: Type of change (added, removed, or changed)

previousValue.description: Previous field value (only present for changed type)

url.description: URL where the change was detected

screenshotUrl.description: URL of the screenshot taken when the change was detected

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the change was created

400.description: Bad request (invalid change ID format)

401.description: Unauthorized (invalid or missing API key or Bearer token)

403.description: Forbidden (no access to the workflow or workflow not real-time enabled)

x-code-samples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.kadoa.com/v4/changes/123456789"
headers = {
    "x-api-key": "YOUR_API_KEY"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
data = response.json()
print(data)

x-filter-options.description:
The 'filters' parameter accepts a JSON-encoded array of filter objects. Each filter object should have the following structure:

{
  "field": "fieldName",
  "operator": "OPERATOR",
  "value": "filterValue"
}

Available operators:
- EQUALS: Exact match
- NOT_EQUALS: Does not match
- CONTAINS: Field contains the value (case-insensitive)
- NOT_CONTAINS: Field does not contain the value (case-insensitive)
- STARTS_WITH: Field starts with the value (case-insensitive)
- ENDS_WITH: Field ends with the value (case-insensitive)
- GREATER_THAN: Field is greater than the value
- LESS_THAN: Field is less than the value
- GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL: Field is greater than or equal to the value
- LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL: Field is less than or equal to the value
- IN: Field value is in the provided array
- NOT_IN: Field value is not in the provided array
- IS_NULL: Field is null
- IS_NOT_NULL: Field is not null
- IS_EMPTY: Field is null or an empty string
- IS_NOT_EMPTY: Field is not null and not an empty string

Example:
[
  {"field": "jobTitle", "operator": "CONTAINS", "value": "Manager"},
  {"field": "postedDate", "operator": "GREATER_THAN", "value": "2023-01-01"},
  {"field": "department", "operator": "IN", "value": ["Sales", "Marketing"]}
]

CreateCrawlerConfigRequest.title: CreateCrawlerConfigRequest
CreateCrawlerConfigRequest.description: Request body for creating a new crawling configuration

url.description: Single URL to start crawling (for backward compatibility)

pathsFilterIn.description: Regex patterns to include specific paths

pathsFilterOut.description: Regex patterns to exclude specific paths

maxPages.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl

maxMatches.description: Maximum number of matched pages to crawl before stopping

strictDomain.description: Whether to stay within the same domain

loadImages.description: Whether to load images during crawling

processDuringCrawl.description: Whether to run preprocessing and extraction during the crawl phase

matchThreshold.description: Match threshold override for blueprint filtering

extractions.description: Feature toggles for available extraction helpers

entity.description: Entity metadata used for extraction mappings

extractionOptions.description: Extraction-related options derived from legacy launch summary

browserActions.description: Ordered list of scripted browser actions executed after navigation

preBrowserActions.description: Browser actions performed before the main action chain

scrollHtml.description: Enable HTML capture while scrolling through the page

visualHtml.description: Enable visual HTML capture for navigation heuristics

loadHtmlOnly.description: Skip scripted interactions and only capture HTML

navigationOptions.description: Navigation-related options derived from legacy launch summary

screenshotLink.description: Stored screenshot link for follow-up processing

archivePdf.description: Generate archival PDF for crawled pages

artifactOptions.description: Artifact capture options derived from legacy launch summary

StartCrawlerSessionRequest.title: StartCrawlerSessionRequest
StartCrawlerSessionRequest.description: Schema for starting a crawling session with support for both single URL and multiple URLs

configId.description: Config ID (included when creating config and starting session)

StartCrawlerSessionResponse.title: StartCrawlerSessionResponse
StartCrawlerSessionResponse.description: Response schema for starting a crawling session

configId.description: Configuration ID to use for this session

StartSessionWithConfigRequest.title: StartSessionWithConfigRequest
StartSessionWithConfigRequest.description: Schema for starting a session with an existing configuration

PauseCrawlerSessionRequest.title: PauseCrawlerSessionRequest
PauseCrawlerSessionRequest.description: Schema for pausing a crawling session

PauseCrawlerSessionResponse.title: PauseCrawlerSessionResponse
PauseCrawlerSessionResponse.description: Response schema for pausing a crawling session

ResumeCrawlerSessionRequest.title: ResumeCrawlerSessionRequest
ResumeCrawlerSessionRequest.description: Schema for resuming a crawling session

ResumeCrawlerSessionResponse.title: ResumeCrawlerSessionResponse
ResumeCrawlerSessionResponse.description: Response schema for resuming a crawling session

payload.description: Details about the crawling session status

GetCrawlerSessionStatusResponse.title: GetCrawlerSessionStatusResponse
GetCrawlerSessionStatusResponse.description: Response schema for getting a crawling session status

id.description: Unique ID of the crawled page

payload.description: List of crawled pages with statuses

GetCrawlerSessionPagesResponse.title: GetCrawlerSessionPagesResponse
GetCrawlerSessionPagesResponse.description: Response schema for getting paginated session pages

payload.description: Data associated with the specific page

pageFormat.description: Format of the retrieved page data

GetCrawlerSessionPageResponse.title: GetCrawlerSessionPageResponse
GetCrawlerSessionPageResponse.description: Response schema for getting a specific session page content

GetCrawlerBucketDataResponse.title: GetCrawlerBucketDataResponse
GetCrawlerBucketDataResponse.description: Response schema for getting a crawling bucket data - returns file stream for HTML/images

totalPages.description: Total number of pages in the session

created_at.description: Timestamp when the entry was created

html_filename.description: Base64 encoded filename for the HTML content (null when HTML not stored)

screenshot_filename.description: Base64 encoded filename for the screenshot (null when screenshot not available)

processed_html_filename.description: Base64 encoded filename for the processed Kadoa HTML

json_filename.description: Base64 encoded filename for the crawler result JSON

match_score.description: Match score between 0 and 1 (null when blueprint not provided)

matched_fields.description: Number of blueprint fields populated for the page

total_fields.description: Total blueprint fields evaluated for matching

is_match.description: Whether the page met the blueprint match threshold

data.description: List of pages in the session

GetCrawlerSessionDataListResponse.title: GetCrawlerSessionDataListResponse
GetCrawlerSessionDataListResponse.description: Response schema for getting a crawling session data list

isKey.description: Whether the field is a key field

DataField.title: DataField
DataField.description: Extract and structure specific data from web pages with typed values (e.g., product prices, article titles, dates). Use this for actual data you want to capture.

metadataKey.description: Key of the metadata field (html or markdown)

RawContentField.title: RawContentField
RawContentField.description: Capture raw page content (HTML or Markdown) for further processing. Use this when you need the unstructured content for post-processing or AI analysis.

categories.description: List of predefined categories for classification

ClassificationField.title: ClassificationField
ClassificationField.description: Categorize extracted data into predefined labels. Use this when you want the system to classify content into specific categories you define.

SchemasListResponse.title: SchemasListResponse
SchemasListResponse.description: Response wrapper for list of schemas

SchemaDataResponse.title: SchemaDataResponse
SchemaDataResponse.description: Response wrapper for a single schema

fields.description: Schema fields for extraction - choose from Data Field (typed data), Raw Content Field (HTML/Markdown), or Classification Field (predefined categories)

CreateSchemaBody.title: CreateSchemaBody
CreateSchemaBody.description: Request body for creating a new schema

UpdateSchemaBody.title: UpdateSchemaBody
UpdateSchemaBody.description: Request body for updating a schema

isoCode.description: Country ISO code for manual location

Location.title: Location
Location.description: Geographic location for scraping. Use 'auto' for automatic detection or 'manual' to specify a country

fieldName.description: Name of the field to monitor

selector.description: CSS selector for the target element (required for CLICK, HOVER)

url.description: URL to navigate to (required for GOTO)

tagName.description: HTML tag name of the element

innerText.description: Inner text content of the element

BrowserInteraction.title: BrowserInteraction

WebExtensionInteraction.title: WebExtensionInteraction
WebExtensionInteraction.description: Web extension interaction in complex format

Interaction.title: Interaction
Interaction.description: Browser interaction definition. Accepts both simple format (with selector, text, url) and complex format from browser extensions

urls.description: List of URLs to scrape. Can be a single URL or multiple URLs to scrape across different pages or domains.

navigationMode.description: Must be set to 'agentic-navigation' for agentic workflows

name.description: Human-readable name for this workflow (e.g., 'Product Catalog Scraper')

description.description: Detailed description of what this workflow does and why it was created (maximum 500 characters)

tags.description: Tags for organizing and categorizing workflows (minimum 3 characters per tag)

limit.description: Maximum number of items to scrape. Useful for limiting scope during development or cost control

interval.description: How frequently this workflow should run (ONLY_ONCE, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, etc.)

schedules.description: Cron expressions for custom schedules. Overrides the interval setting for fine-grained control

bypassPreview.description: Skip preview and validation, deploy scraper immediately. Use with caution - set to true only when you're confident the configuration is correct

autoStart.description: Automatically start the workflow after creation. Set to false if you want to test/review before starting

interactions.description: Browser interactions to perform before scraping (e.g., clicking buttons, filling forms, scrolling). See Interaction schema for available action types

dataValidationEnabled.description: Enable data quality validation. When true, scraped data is validated against the schema and anomalies are detected

additionalData.description: Additional data for the workflow (e.g. IDs from your system to link data)

userPrompt.description: Natural language instructions for the AI agent (10-5000 characters). Describe what data to extract and how to navigate the site

schemaId.description: Optional: Schema ID to use with agentic extraction

entity.description: Optional: Entity name for agentic extraction

fields.description: Optional: Additional extraction fields to guide the agent

AgenticWorkflow.title: AgenticWorkflow
AgenticWorkflow.description:
Create an AI-powered workflow that uses natural language instructions to intelligently extract and adapt data extraction based on page content. The agent can navigate complex sites and understand context.

Example: `{"urls": ["https://example.com"], "navigationMode": "agentic-navigation", "userPrompt": "Extract all job listings with title, company, salary, and location. Click on each listing to get full details."}`

urls.description: List of URLs to scrape. Can be a single URL or multiple URLs to scrape across different pages or domains.

name.description: Human-readable name for this workflow (e.g., 'Product Catalog Scraper')

description.description: Detailed description of what this workflow does and why it was created (maximum 500 characters)

tags.description: Tags for organizing and categorizing workflows (minimum 3 characters per tag)

limit.description: Maximum number of items to scrape. Useful for limiting scope during development or cost control

interval.description: How frequently this workflow should run (ONLY_ONCE, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, etc.)

schedules.description: Cron expressions for custom schedules. Overrides the interval setting for fine-grained control

bypassPreview.description: Skip preview and validation, deploy scraper immediately. Use with caution - set to true only when you're confident the configuration is correct

autoStart.description: Automatically start the workflow after creation. Set to false if you want to test/review before starting

interactions.description: Browser interactions to perform before scraping (e.g., clicking buttons, filling forms, scrolling). See Interaction schema for available action types

dataValidationEnabled.description: Enable data quality validation. When true, scraped data is validated against the schema and anomalies are detected

additionalData.description: Additional data for the workflow (e.g. IDs from your system to link data)

fields.description: Array of fields to extract from each item. Each field defines a property to capture (e.g., title, price, description)

WorkflowWithEntityAndFields.title: WorkflowWithEntityAndFields
WorkflowWithEntityAndFields.description:
Create a workflow by defining extraction entity and fields directly in the request. Inline your schema definition to quickly set up custom data extraction without creating a schema separately.

Example: `{"urls": ["https://example.com"], "entity": "Product", "fields": [{"name": "title", "description": "Product title", "fieldType": "SCHEMA", "dataType": "STRING"}, {"name": "price", "description": "Product price", "fieldType": "SCHEMA", "dataType": "NUMBER"}]}`

urls.description: List of URLs to scrape. Can be a single URL or multiple URLs to scrape across different pages or domains.

name.description: Human-readable name for this workflow (e.g., 'Product Catalog Scraper')

description.description: Detailed description of what this workflow does and why it was created (maximum 500 characters)

tags.description: Tags for organizing and categorizing workflows (minimum 3 characters per tag)

limit.description: Maximum number of items to scrape. Useful for limiting scope during development or cost control

interval.description: How frequently this workflow should run (ONLY_ONCE, HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, etc.)

schedules.description: Cron expressions for custom schedules. Overrides the interval setting for fine-grained control

bypassPreview.description: Skip preview and validation, deploy scraper immediately. Use with caution - set to true only when you're confident the configuration is correct

autoStart.description: Automatically start the workflow after creation. Set to false if you want to test/review before starting

interactions.description: Browser interactions to perform before scraping (e.g., clicking buttons, filling forms, scrolling). See Interaction schema for available action types

dataValidationEnabled.description: Enable data quality validation. When true, scraped data is validated against the schema and anomalies are detected

additionalData.description: Additional data for the workflow (e.g. IDs from your system to link data)

schemaId.description: ID of an existing schema configuration. Use this to reference a previously defined schema without re-defining extraction fields

WorkflowWithExistingSchema.title: WorkflowWithExistingSchema
WorkflowWithExistingSchema.description:
Create a workflow using a pre-defined schema configuration. Reference an existing schema by ID to extract data without re-defining fields. Perfect when you have multiple workflows using the same data structure.

Example: `{"urls": ["https://example.com"], "schemaId": "schema-abc123", "interval": "DAILY"}`

CreateWorkflowBody.title: CreateWorkflowBody
CreateWorkflowBody.description: Request body for creating a new workflow
